TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Emphasis extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlLeafElement

Docs.summary: Defines the Emphasis Class. When the object is serialized out as xml, its qualified name is w:em.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)]
**em (Emphasis Mark)**
This element specifies the emphasis mark which shall be displayed for each non-space character in this run. An *emphasis mark* is an additional character that is rendered above or below the main character glyph as specified by the contents of the val attribute.
If this element is not present, the default value is to leave the formatting applied at previous level in the *style hierarchy*. If this element is never applied in the style hierarchy, then no emphasis mark shall be added to each character in the contents of this run.
[*Example*: Consider a run of text which must have a dot underneath each character as an emphasis mark. This constraint is specified using the following WordprocessingML:
```xml <w:rPr> <w:em w:val="dot"/> </w:rPr> ```
This run explicitly declares that the emphasis mark type is *dot*, so the contents of this run has a dot emphasis mark above each character. *end example*]
|Parent Elements| |---------------------| |rPr (§17.3.1.29); rPr (§17.3.1.30); rPr (§17.5.2.28); rPr (§17.9.25); rPr (§17.7.9.1); rPr (§17.7.5.4); rPr (§17.3.2.28); rPr (§17.5.2.27); rPr (§17.7.6.2); rPr (§17.3.2.27)|
[*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_Em) is located in §A.1. *end note*]
[!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Val As EnumValue(Of EmphasisMarkValues)

Docs.summary: Emphasis Mark Type.Represents the following attribute in the schema: w:val

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following information from the ECMA International [Standard ECMA-376](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-376.htm) can be useful when working with this class.
Specifies the emphasis mark type used for each character in this run.
Consider a run of text which shall have a dot underneath each character as an emphasis mark. This constraint is specified using the following WordprocessingML:
``` <w:rPr> <w:em w:val="dot"/> </w:rPr> ```
This run explicitly declares that the `em` type is `dot`, so the contents of this run will have a dot emphasis mark beneath each character.
The possible values for this attribute are defined by the `ST_Em` simple type.
